The stacking factor is the indication of the percentage by which the volume is increased at stacking a second item quantity unit of the same item (e.g. bucket: stacking factor 3% 1 bucket 100% 2 buckets: 103% with each bucket, the volume is increased by 3% of a bucket). The stacking factor "can be null", that means if it is null, the stacking factor is not used by the volume calculation (min. value = 1%).

Indicates whether this item quantity unit is used to mark a loading unit as whole loading unit for incoming goods process. It's also used to calculate the number of whole loading units for capacatiy planing.
Indicates whether this item quantity represents one layer of a loading unit.
